title: Liz Breadon elected Boston City Council president in last-minute shakeup
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Breadon narrowly edged out Councilor Brian Worrell in a vote Monday.
Council President Liz Breadon.
John Tlumacki/Boston Globe In a last-minute twist, Councilor Liz Breadon was narrowly elected by her colleagues to lead the body as City Council president Monday.

title: Raiders say Tom Brady will work closely with GM to pick Las Vegas’s next head coach
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Pete Carroll was fired and the Raiders need a new coach.
Brady is expected to have a role in the search.
Tom Brady AP Photo/Kyusung Gong The Raiders released a statement on Monday morning, announcing their decision to fire head coach Pete Carroll.

title: How a local app has saved Pats games for Fios customers
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News With the Fox blackout dragging on, Local TV+ became the go-to workaround for fans two weekends in a row.
New England Patriots safety Jaylinn Hawkins (21) celebrates with teammates after a touchdown during a game against the New York Jets, Sunday, Dec.
28, 2025, in New York.

title: Man accused of raping fellow patient at Boston Medical Center pleads not guilty
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime In her detention order, Judge Sarah Weyland Ellis noted Barry Howze’s alleged victim was “particularly vulnerable” because she was paralyzed on one side of her body.
A view of Boston Medical Center.

Jessica Rinaldi/Boston Globe Staff, File By Abby Patkin January 5, 2026 | 3:45 PM 1 minute to read A Boston man accused of raping another patient at Boston Medical Center in September pleaded not guilty to a slew of charges Monday.

title: What do you think of the Kraft Group’s deal to build a New England Revolution soccer stadium?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us Do you have concerns about the impact the stadium could have on traffic, the environment, and public transit?
The Krafts want to build a professional soccer stadium on land of a power plant on Alford Street.

(John Tlumacki/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas January 5, 2026 | 3:39 PM 2 minutes to read The Kraft Group, owners of the New England Revolution, announced last week that they’ve reached agreements with the cities of Boston and Everett to move forward with a new soccer stadium along the Mystic River in Everett.

title: Wakefield man ‘vanished,’ has been missing for 3 weeks, wife says
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Jason Thomas’s family and friends have kept up search efforts, calling his disappearance “every loved one’s worst nightmare.
” Jason Thomas has been missing since Dec.

title: Parts of Boston Harbor meet shellfish consumption standards for first time in 100 years, state says
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food The state's Division of Marine Fisheries is in the process of reclassifying parts of the outer Boston Harbor so that shellfish will be allowed for direct human consumption.
Clams at the state's purification plant.

Joanne Rathe/Boston Globe For the first time in a century and after a multi-billion-dollar, decades-long clean-up, parts of the once toxic Boston Harbor waters meet water quality standards that will allow for direct harvest and human consumption of shellfish.

title: Boston man pleads not guilty to murder in art collector’s hit-and-run death
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime “It’s an incredibly tragic case that is about mental illness,” an attorney for William Haney said.
John Axelrod in 2011.

Dina Rudick/The Boston Globe By Abby Patkin January 5, 2026 | 2:09 PM 2 minutes to read A 42-year-old Boston man pleaded not guilty to murder and animal cruelty charges Monday in the hit-and-run death of prominent art collector John Axelrod, who was struck and killed while walking his dog in the Back Bay over the weekend.

title: Are you running the 2026 Boston Marathon? Share your story with us.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us We want to know what inspired you to run Boston.
Runners reaching the one mile to go marker in Kenmore Square during the 129th Boston Marathon in Boston, MA on April 21, 2025.

Matthew J Lee/Globe Staff By Annie Jonas January 5, 2026 | 1:51 PM 1 minute to read The 130th Boston Marathon is just around the corner, and athletes from around the world are preparing for the monumental race.

title: Wu evokes American Revolution as she is sworn in for second term
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Mayor Michelle Wu said that Boston will be a "beacon" for the country over the next four years.
Mayor Michelle Wu delivers her inaugural address inside Boston Symphony Hall to begin her second term.
David L.
